ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Few questions about NEAT [1 Attachment]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Tomas, NEAT can create RNNs or FFNNs, but if you are creating FFNNs then you have to have some way of testing if adding a connection will add a cycle. I

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Tomas,

NEAT can create RNNs or FFNNs, but if you are creating FFNNs the=
n you have
to have some way of testing if adding a connection will add a cy=
cle.

I don't know what others do, I do a topological sort of my ANNs anywa=
y when
converting them into weight matrices, so.I reused the code (a topolo=
gical
sort fails if there are cycles). Here is code to do it in context (
h=
ttps://github.com/agaier/matNEAT/blob/master/neat/recombination/is_Cyclic.m=
).
It might be worth looking at some other implementations as well, there b=
e a
nice trick out there, but the result is the same.

adam

>

ling x% of worstest individuals and re-generate a new
> randomic instead of=
 mating them?
>

<div dir=3D"auto">Hi Tomas,<div><br></div><div>NEAT can create RNNs or FFNN=

if adding a connection will add a cycle.</div><div><br></div><div>I don&#39=
;t know what others do, I do a topological sort of my ANNs anyway when conv=
erting them into weight matrices, so.I reused the code (a topological sort =
fails if there are cycles). Here is code to do it in context (<a href=3D"ht=
tps://github.com/agaier/matNEAT/blob/master/neat/recombination/is_Cyclic.m"=

      <p>Hello everybody,<br><br>I have a few question=

that is used Feed Forward ANN but how is it possibile if any input is conne=
cted to any output and different hidden neurons?<br><br>2) For example, is =
it possibile a ANN like this (please see the attachment, no lines =3D conne=
ctions disabled)?<br><br>3) Isn't better killing x% of worstest individ=
uals and re-generate a new randomic instead of mating them?</p>
